description: The Transport for London Supplier Awards is our chance to recognise the excellent work our supply chain does for us, and recognising the contribution that a wide range of companies make to running and improving transport in our capital

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["The TfL Supplier Awards is our chance to recognise the excellent work our supply chain does for us, and the contribution that a wide range of companies make to running and improving transport in London."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

{"template":"image","link":{"image":{}},"image":{"url":"https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/images/tfl-suppliers-awards-2017_rdax_400x250.jpg","alt":"TfL Supplier Awards 2017 at the London Transport Museum"},"wrapped":false}
The 2018 TfL Supplier Awards ceremony will take place at the London Transport Museum on Wednesday 5 December.

This year, the awards are open to all our suppliers for their efforts in a range of areas, from increasing opportunities for those underrepresented in the workplace to their work to protect the environment.
We're inviting submissions in the following categories:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Health, Safety and Environment","Efficiencies and Innovation","Collaboration","Diversity and Inclusion","Small and Medium Enterprise"]}
Submissions open from Wednesday 15 August and close on Tuesday 11 September.
Read the full list of categories and evaluation criteria:

Last year, there were 80 submissions and Siemens were recognised as TfL's Supplier of the Year. They had proven themselves to be an outstanding supplier, working with us to support women back into employment and developing the potential of those already in the transport industry. They also developed their operational practices when installing traffic signals to increase efficiency and reduce the impact on customers and have been a key part of the success of delivering 36 trains per hour on the Victoria line.
See more photos of the 2017 Supplier Awards ceremony on Flickr .
